en.purpose: To calculate RSI score and its interpretation.

other_details.references:
Belafsky PC, Postma GN, Koufman JA. Validity and reliability of the reflux symptom index (RSI). J Voice. 2002 Jun;16(2):274-7. doi: 10.1016/s0892-1997(02)00097-8. PMID: 12150380.

Brauer DL, Tse KY, Lin JC, Schatz MX, Simon RA. The Utility of the Reflux Symptom Index for Diagnosis of Laryngopharyngeal Reflux in an Allergy Patient Population. J Allergy Clin Immunol Pract. 2018 Jan-Feb;6(1):132-138.e1. doi: 10.1016/j.jaip.2017.04.039. Epub 2017 Jun 9. PMID: 28606786.

gt0001.description: Reflux Symptoms Index assesses laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR) symptoms and their severity to help with diagnosis.

gt0003.text: Hoarseness or a problem with your voice
gt0003.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0004.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0005.text: Excess throat mucous or postnasal drip
gt0005.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0006.text: Difficulty swallowing food, liquids or pills
gt0006.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0007.text: Coughing after you ate or after lying down
gt0007.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0008.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0009.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0010.text: Sensations or something sticking in your throat
gt0010.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0011.text: Heart burn, chest pain, indigestion, or stomach acid coming up
gt0011.description: Rate with values from 0 to 5 where 0 = No problem and 5 = Severe problem.

gt0019.text: Normative data suggests that a RSI greater than or equal to 13 is clinically significant and may be indicative of significant reflux disease.
